## Weekly exposures

Weekly person centric exposure table.

(suffix **\_1**: with the model outputs generated on 13th October, 2025. before fixing the bug with PA (of not using gravity in its calculations) and not using precalculated network for cycling. Code used [SHA](https://github.com/Public-Health-Modelling-Cambridge/silo/tree/20f982fc47b0d470aaac88e816fd717f39f7099b))

(suffix **\_2**: latest run with the model outputs generated on 16th October, 2025, after fixing the bug with PA using gravity, and updating link exposures for AP. Code used [SHA](https://github.com/Public-Health-Modelling-Cambridge/silo/tree/8dc88c6fe181d9a553f6f807a6c7b18d12b1bb6b))

zones <- read_csv("/media/ali/Expansion/backup_tabea/manchester-main/input/zoneSystem.csv")

add_zones_and_scen <- function(df, zones, scen = "reference"){
  return(
    df |> left_join(zones |> 
                      dplyr::select(oaID, imd10, ladnm) |> 
                      rename(zone = oaID)) |> 
      mutate(scen = scen)
  )
}

# Function to calculate quantiles for columns starting with "exp" with optional grouping
calc_quantiles_grouped <- function(data, group_var = NULL) {
  # data <- df
  quantile_probs <- c(5, 25, 50, 75, 95)
  quantile_names <- c("5%", "25%", "50%", "75%", "95%")
  
  if (!is.null(group_var)) {
    group_vars_sym <- if (length(group_var) > 1) {
      rlang::syms(group_var)
    } else {
      rlang::sym(group_var)
    }
    grouped_df <- data |> group_by(!!!group_vars_sym)
  } else {
    grouped_df <- data
  }
  
  
  summarised <- grouped_df |>
    summarise(
      across(
        matches("^(exposure|total_PA)"),
        list(
          `5%` = ~ quantile(.x, 0.05),
          `25%` = ~ quantile(.x, 0.25),
          `50%` = ~ quantile(.x, 0.5),
          `75%` = ~ quantile(.x, 0.75),
          `95%` = ~ quantile(.x, 0.95)
        ),
        .names = "{.col}_{.fn}"
      ),
      .groups = "drop"
    ) |>
    pivot_longer(
      cols = -all_of(group_var),
      names_to = c("variable", "quantile"),
      names_pattern = "^(.*)_(.*)$"
    ) |>
    mutate(quantile = factor(quantile, levels = quantile_names)) |>
    arrange(across(all_of(group_var)), variable, quantile)
  return(summarised)
}

# Example usage with your dataframe `df`
overall <- calc_quantiles_grouped(df, "scen")
by_gender <- calc_quantiles_grouped(df, c("scen", "gender"))
by_ladnm <- calc_quantiles_grouped(df, c("scen", "ladnm"))
by_agegroup <- calc_quantiles_grouped(df, c("scen", "agegroup"))
# Add grouping column to differentiate
overall <- overall |> mutate(grouping = "Overall")
by_gender <- by_gender |> mutate(grouping = paste("Gender:", gender)) |> select(-gender)
by_ladnm <- by_ladnm |> mutate(grouping = paste("LADNM:", ladnm)) |> select(-ladnm)
by_agegroup <- by_agegroup |> mutate(grouping = paste("Agegroup:", agegroup)) |> select(-agegroup)
# Bind all results into one dataframe
all_quantiles <- bind_rows(overall, by_gender, by_ladnm, by_agegroup) #|>
  #select(grouping, variable, quantile, value)
# Create a wide format table for gt display
gt_table <- all_quantiles |>
  pivot_wider(names_from = quantile, values_from = value) |>
  gt(groupname_col = "grouping") |>
  tab_header(title = "Quantiles for exp Columns by Groupings") |>
  cols_label(
    grouping = "Group",
    variable = "Variable",
    `5%` = "5th",
    `25%` = "25th Percentile",
    `50%` = "Median",
    `75%` = "75th Percentile",
    `95%` = "95th"
  )

           
# Define a color function that maps normalized values (0â€“1) to a color between lightpink and lightgreen
col_fun <- col_numeric(palette = c("lightpink", "lightgreen"), domain = c(0, 1))
# Pivot the data so that each row is defined by grouping, variable, and quantile,
# with one column per scen.
wide_df <- all_quantiles |>
  pivot_wider(
    id_cols = c(grouping, variable, quantile),
    names_from = scen,
    values_from = value
  )
# Compute row-wise min and max and generate HTML formatting without using cell_spec.
# Each cell's background color is determined by its normalized value relative to the row.
formatted_df <- wide_df |>
  rowwise() |>
  mutate(
    row_min = min(c_across(c(reference_1, reference_2, green_1, green_2, safeStreet_1, safeStreet_2, both_1, both_2)), na.rm = TRUE),
    row_max = max(c_across(c(reference_1, reference_2, green_1, green_2, safeStreet_1, safeStreet_2, both_1, both_2)), na.rm = TRUE),
    reference_1_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (reference_1 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    reference_2_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (reference_2 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    both_1_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (both_1 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    both_2_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (both_2 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    green_1_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (green_1 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    green_2_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (green_2 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    safeStreet_1_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (safeStreet_1 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    safeStreet_2_norm = if_else(row_max == row_min, 0.5, (safeStreet_2 - row_min) / (row_max - row_min)),
    reference_1_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(reference_1_norm)}'>{round(reference_1, 2)}</div>"),
    reference_2_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(reference_2_norm)}'>{round(reference_2, 2)}</div>"),
    both_1_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(both_1_norm)}'>{round(both_1, 2)}</div>"),
    both_2_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(both_2_norm)}'>{round(both_2, 2)}</div>"),
    green_1_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(green_1_norm)}'>{round(green_1, 2)}</div>"),
    green_2_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(green_2_norm)}'>{round(green_2, 2)}</div>"),
    
    safeStreet_1_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(safeStreet_1_norm)}'>{round(safeStreet_1, 2)}</div>"),
    safeStreet_2_html = glue("<div style='background-color:{col_fun(safeStreet_2_norm)}'>{round(safeStreet_2, 2)}</div>")
  ) |>
  ungroup()
# Create a gt table using the HTML formatted cells; group by 'grouping'.
gt_tbl <- formatted_df |>
  select(grouping, variable, quantile, contains("html")) |>
  # Combine variable and quantile into one row label.
  #mutate(var_quant = paste(variable, "(", quantile, ")", sep = "")) |>
  #select(-variable, -quantile) |>
  gt(groupname_col = "grouping", rowname_col = "") |>

    both_2_html = "V2: Greening + Safer Streets",
    green_1_html = "V1: Greening",
    green_2_html = "V2: Greening",
    safeStreet_1_html = "V1: Safer Streets",
    safeStreet_2_html = "V2: Safer Streets"
  ) |>
  # fmt_markdown(
  #   columns = c(both_1_html, green_html, reference_html, safeStreet_html)
  # ) |>
  tab_options(table.font.size = "small") |> 
  opt_interactive(use_filters = T,

gt_tbl
